iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: Kituntu Integrated Community Development Project. The objective of the programme is to improve the quality of life of 19_769 people of Kituntu sub-county. Access to quality primary and secondary education and adult literacy will be increased. Access to better health services and hygiene/sanitation will be improved and both health and socio-economic impact of HIV/AIDS at individual_ household and community levels mitigated. Household Food Security and resilience and community capacity to manage their own development will be improved.

iati-activity.title: FUCTIONAL ADULT LITERACY EDUCATION
iati-activity.description: LITERACY PROGRAMME AMONG REFUGEES
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: WELL-BEING IN THE VILLAGE COMMUNITY
iati-activity.description: TO PROMOTE THE WELL-BEING OF THE VILLAGE COMMUNITY ESPECIALLY IN REGARD TO SCHOOL CHILDREN AND HEALTH EDUCATION IN NUTRITIONAL ASPECTS

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: Nabuyoga Community Capacity Enhancement Project. The overall objective is to improve quality of life of 15000 people of Nabuyoga sub county through community based integrated development. Key activities include: HIV/AIDS awareness and life skill acquisition_ promoting girl child rights_community based initiatives to treat depression and provide AIDS prevention_ care and advocacy_ supporting orphans and vulnerable children_ income generation_and business training.

location.name: Nabuyoga sub-county_ West Budama County of Tororo District in Eastern Uganda

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Literacy and Language Training for Adult Refugees
iati-activity.description: The immediate objective of the project is to contribute towards increased self-reliance of refugees as a consequence of an improved education level. The project organises FAL training in Kyaka II refugee communities. Literacy and numeric skills combined with improved ability to analyse the environment and living conditions are expected to increase refugee's self-esteem and capacity to actively take efforts to improve their living standards. In addition English, French, business and civic training will be organised.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: NGO SUPPORT / AIDS-ORPHANS SCHOOL CHILDREN SOLIDARITY PROGRAM
iati-activity.description: AIDS ORPHAN SCHOOL CHILDREN WILL BE TOUGHT TO CULTIVATE VEGETABLES AND SMALL ANIMAL HUSBANDRY. WHILE LEARNING THE USEFUL SKILLS THEY ALSO PRODUCE FOOD FOR THEIR SCHOOLS. THEY GET SCHOOL UNIFORMS, BOOKS AND SCHOOL UTILITIES AND THEIR HEALTH CARE WILL BE AR

iati-activity.description: The fulfilment of the human rights of the deaf people through increasing the use of sign language in education, service providers and families.

iati-activity.description: to arrange activities for children in the form of workshops and clubs

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Ensuring the Future of the Young Children through Community-Led Early Childhood Care and Development. To promote and support good parenting skills and practices at home for 0-3 year olds and support 3-6 year olds development through community-led ECCD services. To increase the proportion of pre-school age children participating in ECCD programmes from 12% to 45 % in supported communities

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Int.Solidary Foundation)
iati-activity.description: Prevention of Domestic Violence in Wakiso and Kiboka Districts_ planning phase. Finalising the project plan for the prevention of domestic violence in Wakiso and Kiboga in 2009-2011 .

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Int.Solidary Foundation)
iati-activity.description: Household Poverty Reduction_ planning phase. Finalising the project plan for Household poverty reduction through enhanced production and access to markets among rural poor in Namayumba sub-county Wakiso district.

iati-activity.description: Empowering Farmers_ planning phase. Finalising the project plan for Empowering farmers project

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: Kirewa Area Development Project. Goal is to develop intervention for long term partnership with Kirewa community by end of 2008. Design covers development priorities for a definere period and which are identified during assessment

location.name: Kirewa community_ Totoro District in Eastern Uganda

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: Paya Area Development Project. The goal of the assessment project is to identify the existing structural problems_ their root causes_ community vulnerabilities_ existing capacities_ opportunities and resources in Paya Sub County. The information obtained will be used to ascertain the viability and feasibility of a long term partnership with Paya community and inform the decision to establish an Area Development Program in Paya.

location.name: Paya Sub County_ Totoro District in Eastern Uganda

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: Busia Area Development Project. To find out the true status of the town council on the various issues that affect the wellbeing of vulnerable children and the most vulnerable in consonance with the national office strategy.

location.name: Busia Town Council_ Totoro District in Eastern Uganda

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Women_s Empowering Radio
iati-activity.description: Purpose of the project is to strenghten women around Kampala area by improving working possibilities_ supporting health and increasing women_s knowledge and skills by giving education_ information_ and counseling in their local languages. MAMA FM radio station will be supported through education and consultation and by developing community information systems especially for women. New ways to raise money for radio are being searched for.

iati-activity.description: Psychosocial Support to the Most Vulnerable Children. Psychosocial Support to the Most Vulnerable Children

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Sembabule Community-based HIV/AIDS Project . Promotion of correct HIV/AIDS information to people, improved capacity of communities and families to take care of their HIV-positive members, improved quality of life of HIV/AIDS orphans.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Katakwi Integrated Rural Development Project. Support to internally displaced people and local organisations. Promotion of HIV/AIDS awareness, improvement of food security, livelihoods and sanitation.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Reconstruction and development cooperation in Kitgum/Pader . The project is a pilot project on LRRD in the country. Work methods, activities and results will be planned and described meticulously so that the project would be replicable later.
iati-activity.sector: Multisector aid for basic social services

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Adult Education for Refugees in Nakivale
iati-activity.description: The project organises FAL training in refugee community Nakivale. In addition English and French and business courses are organised. The overall objective is to alleviate poverty, increase self-reliance among refugee population as well prepare the refugees for the repatriation in the future.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Creating conditions necessary for the establishment of sustainable peace and development in Uganda
iati-activity.description: Assist in creating conditions necessary for the establishment of sustainable peace and development in Uganda through promoting and protecting human rights, strenghtening the rule of law and establishing accountability for serious and systematic human rights abuses.
